page.title: 12The Bottleworks
page.content: To make glass in the eighteenth century the following materials would be required: {1.Sand}An abundant supply of sand, the more pure the sand, the whiter the glass.{2.Coal}You need a lot of coal to heat the furnace to melt the sand into molten material.{ {3.Salt}This was obtained from heating and evaporating seawater in large pans.{4.Seaweed}(Kelp) This was used as a "flux" to help mix the salt and sand in the furnace.{5.Clay}The clay was used to make pot furnaces. Each pot had to be renewed every few months.{6.Firebricks}Firebricks were hard, heat resistant stone which encased each pot furnace.{7.Fresh {water}A plentiful supply was needed for wetting the clay and cooling equipment.
